parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the crankshaft pulley bolt can cause the engine to stall or seize, leading to a loss of power and control, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The engine dies or stalls without warning
the crankshaft pulley bolt comes loose or breaks off
the vehicle is unable to start or run properly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive oil consumption can lead to engine damage, premature wear, and potentially cause engine failure, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle consumes an excessive amount of oil
the oil level drops rapidly
the engine makes unusual noises or smells.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire failure can cause loss of control, accidents, or leave the driver stranded, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The tire blows out or loses air suddenly
the vehicle vibrates or pulls to one side
the tire shows signs of uneven wear or damage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine problems can cause loss of power, stalling, or engine failure, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The engine throws a rod or makes unusual noises
the vehicle has difficulty starting or running
the engine overheats or shows signs of damage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Battery and electrical issues can cause the vehicle to stall or fail to start, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The battery keeps moving or is not properly secured
the vehicle has difficulty starting or running
the electrical system malfunctions or shows signs of damage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the harmonic balancer/pulley can cause a loss of power steering, making it difficult to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The harmonic balancer/pulley breaks or falls off
the power steering light comes on
the battery light comes on
loss of power steering
difficulty steering the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering column can cause a loss of control of the vehicle, making it difficult or impossible to steer, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The steering column fails
the vehicle is difficult to steer
the vehicle is impossible to steer.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the seat belt buckle can cause the seat belt to malfunction, increasing the risk of injury or death in the event of an accident.
symptoms: The seat belt buckle fails
the seat belt does not latch properly
the seat belt does not restrain the occupant properly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine oil leaks can cause damage to the engine and surrounding components, leading to costly repairs and potentially causing the engine to seize, resulting in a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Oil leaking from the engine
oil spots under the vehicle
low oil pressure warnings
engine noise or knocking sounds.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Worn-out brake rotors can cause reduced stopping power, increasing the risk of accidents and potentially leading to brake failure.
symptoms: Metal-to-metal grinding sound when applying the brakes
excessive stopping distance
brake rotors wearing thin
frequent brake rotor replacements.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine overheating can cause damage to the engine and cooling system, leading to costly repairs and potentially causing the engine to seize, resulting in a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Temperature gauge rising
coolant leaks
engine noise or knocking sounds
steam coming from the hood.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden separation of the tire tread can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The tread comes off the tire while driving
the tire loses air pressure suddenly
the vehicle vibrates or pulls to one side
the tire makes a loud noise or produces a loud thud.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Unintended acceleration can cause loss of control, accidents, and injuries, especially when the vehicle is stopped or braking.
symptoms: The vehicle accelerates or surges forward when coming to a stop
the vehicle revs or idles excessively
the vehicle seems to get gas from an unknown source
the vehicle accelerates without driver input.
